ratings.comment: With little to no labs (So much so we almost didn't get enough done for the college credit) and constant lectures. The only thing he truly went over was homework. In the end, he seemed to almost have given up on the class, and even though most got an A+, we learned nothing.

He was my TA for gen chem. He does not keep on task with his bad jokes, references to his previous teaching of ochem, and wondering how he is doing as a teacher. In discussion, he splits us into groups and has us struggle with material we have not even been taught yet! He does not explain anything in multiple ways. Half the time, I am lost!

He's not teaching anymore but I had him back when I took 343. Genuinely cares about his students. He's a funny guy and did a great job of making a comfortable learning environment. His eagerness to constantly improve his teaching abilities really helps make him a great professor. He has really helped set me up for success.

I know Dr. Ress is no longer teaching, and just doing research, but I was in his 343 class when he first started teaching.  He gave extra help to students by being online with a chat session, and he taught pretty well.  Lots of slides, lots of notes.  Difficult course, but fun at the same time.

Terrible terrible prof  Cares more about showing how much he knows than teaching. Exams are ridiculously unfair no partial credit is given so you can show knowledge of a concept and still get zero points on the question. Unless you are a girl who likes to spend lots of time in office hours and sit in the front row do NOT take his class.
Well, he didn't do a good job explaining the material...and sometimes he screw things up because he is an organic chemist instead of an analytical chemist. His tests are amazingly easy though....

I was worried in the beginning of 343 because Dino isn't very good at teaching the basic/gen chem review.  If you make it past the first couple chapters, he does great with the material he really cares about and makes you interested in it to.  Tests are hard, but good curve at the end.  Get to know Dino, he's willing to help you learn.

Bad professor for O. Chem.  His notes are all done in powerpoint, so you rarely see him draw any mechanisms or structures, he teaches analogies rather than concepts, always mentions his Ph.D., and from what I've heard, and makes you laugh at bad jokes. Class isn't too tough, but if you're gonna need this knowledge down the road, don't take him.

It's probably not Dino's fault that he's teaching a class on subject material that he doesn't know much about. Still this is no excuse for his poor organization-the last week of class was loaded with material he should have covered earlier, but was too busy telling awful jokes in class to get around to. He tested us on info he had not explained yet

Dino is one of the nicest and most helpful professors i have had.  Get to know him through office hours!!  He is really down to earth and cares about his students. Also extremely funny and knows what he is talking about!!! I can't say enough good things about him!

Notes are online, plenty of review material for the the tests. His exams require comprehension of material, not just mindless knowledge regurgitation. Just like any chem or math test you just need to break down the questions. He likes to make bad jokes and he makes a lot of them.

Dr. Ress is a really fun professor.  He wants to help you and he makes you want to come to class.  He was really weird at first and kind of awkward, but after the first week I got used to it and then he was great!

OCHEM is different from genchem, don't expect there to be similar mindsets involved.  Think abstractly, don't try to memorize. If you can figure things out as opposed to memorize individual reactions, it will help you more. Dino seems like a nice guy, cares a lot about being fair.  Sit near the front and he'll get to know you, seems knowledgeable.

You can count on smaller details and mechanisms to show up on exams so as long as you know that study everything.  A common way to change the average is to make a problem on an Exam or Problem Set which relates to a smaller detail.  You don't have to work in groups on the homework, just read ahead. Notes are taken for you, so just learn, fun class.

Lacks focus at times. cracks lots of jokes and seems like a nice guy. when exam time comes, his attitude is simply: know your shi#. Suddenly the joke is on you. His exams are meant to trick you, and the class avg reflects that. He seems to have pride issues and does not want a perfect score, which is why he will add unfairly tricky questions. avoid

Dr. Ress is a prime example of a catch 22. He is a good lecturer when he wants to be but most of the time the lectures are filled with bad jokes. His tests are the hardest in the world and his problem sets are made by gnomes. I learned a ton but it was pretty bad dealing with this class. Dr. Ress is not a good professor unless you are in his club.

Dino Ress is extremely conceited and desperate for attention.  He spends too much time making horrible attempts at jokes  instead of teaching.  He also takes up at least a quarter of class time dealing with issues that do not directly relate to the content.

Dr. Ress is pretty full of himself. He talks too much about things that dont relate to class (sports..) His tests are impossible, and the problem sets must be done with a group of classmates. There are A LOT of mistakes in his notes, but he does post them on Learn@UW for you.. Overall, I would avoid him if there was another professor available.

prettttty full of himself, spends a lot more time talking about himself than he should, wastes a lot of time. TONS of notes that are sometimes hard to follow. you have to do a lot of out of class work. exams are hard and very specific. he has his favorites, and if you're not one of them, this class will be very difficult.

I feel like half the class loves him and the other doesn't.  He seems to have obvious favorites (aka girls in the front row that he knows by name and do better than everyone).  Grading is harsh on exams, you can demonstrate knowledge of a concept, but still get 0 points on the question if it's not just what he wanted.

Highly recommended!  Organic chem will not be easy by any means, but he is very fair, and always willing to help!  Powerpoint notes are clear and to the point- but make sure you read the book, too.  As long as you stay on top of things, success in this class is possible.

He's not a bad guy.  The material is really interesting, and don't let the whole "orgo" intimidation affect you. His notes are easy to understand, though I encourage you to draw the structures yourself as well.   Do well on the problem sets, because everyone else will.  Exams are the only big divider, so don't get psyched out.

Best Chem343 professor you can have.  He's very enthusiastic, has Powerpoint notes, picks out what you need to know from the book (but read the chapter before class if you can), and he's very helpful at office hours.  Make sure you go to lecture and memorize all the reactions for the third exam.

I really liked him. The class was hard, but all ochem classes will be. tests aren't easy, you've gotta know the stuff but the curve is very fair.  you can get his powerpoints online before class which really helps for taking notes. and his lectures def helped for understanding the material. plus he's a nice guy & willing to help if u need it.

This guy is the worst professor I have ever had.  None of his exams had a fair distribution probably because he does not know how to write one or grade one.  He is not funny even though he thinks he is, and there was not a single lecture that I left in a good mood.

One of the best profs I've ever had. Really guys, you need to take him. His sense of humor and the fact that he's laid back really take the edge off ochem. Tests are hard, but good luckfinding an easy ochem test. The curves are great..I think my grade was somewhere in the low 60's and I got a B. Take him!!!!! Great guy.

A VERY interesting professors.  The power point slides he makes and goes over in class are very useful.  I highly reccommend him.  He made the class enjoyable and the exams were fair due to the curve.
A very good teacher and approachable outside of class. I think he cares about students and tries his best. Of course the class is difficult but it is OCHEM. Get help with problem sets.

Good person, bad teacher. His exams are EXTREMELY difficult. I'm an A student in Biology major, and I got a C. The class is interesting, but it's almost impossible to study for the exams. He tries to challenge you- REALLY challenge you... so be ready.

I would highly recommend Dino Ress; he made organic chemistry somewhat entertaining. His lecture notes are VERY HELPFUL, I didn't have to read the book and did well. The exams are difficult, but the curves are fair. Problem sets are almost impossible.. GET HELP WITH THEM.. but again, the class is curved, so it's not that big of a deal.

I liked him; he taught the material more effectively than most chem profs could.  The tests were definitely way harder than they needed to be, but the consistently low class average keeps you in the game throughout the course.

Exam questions ambiguous at times--lack clarity.  You may know the information but do poorly simply because you mis interpret it.  Has obvious favorites--coincidently they seem to always be female and they always seem to get 30 pts above the curve. Problem sets are all about who you know and not what you know.
Great proffesor, hard class but he teaches it well.
A horrible horrible teacher. His tests are horrendous and incredibly unfair. His jokes are not funny.

The worst prof I've ever had. Exams are unreasonably difficult. Lectures are very unorganized and boring. He thinks he is funny, but he is not. I get annoyed when I have to laugh at his lousy joke. You can never meet this guy outside of class time cuz his office hrs (12:00-1:00) are  right after class and many of us have a class at the same time.
He is a funny guy.  He makes lectures interesting with his demos.  You have to kind of teach yourself from the material, but he writes fair exams.  No weekly quizzes, so very little hw
Wonderful teacher.  Very organized and helpful.  The textbook is extremely helpful too.  He has a good sense of humor and writes fair exams.
